plugin.name: ðŸ’­ Journalling Helpers
plugin.description: Supports daily journalling in NotePlan, including making it easier to apply start-of-day templates, and end-of-day/week  Reviews, Summaries or Tidy Up. Before use it requires some configuration: please see website for details.
plugin.author: Jonathan Clark
plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
v1.0.0: Rename to 'Journalling Helpers Plugin'. Add new '/dayEnd', '/todayEnd' and '/weekEnd' commands, that run pre-set Templates for Reviews, Summaries or Tidy Up.
v0.15.1: New 'Journalling: update plugin settings' command for use on iOS/iPadOS. v0.15: Added support for Monthly, Quarterly and Yearly review questions. v0.14: Added /weekStart command. 
v0.13: Added support for /weekReview, /monthReview and /quarterlyReview, each of which have settings for their different Review Questions. /dayStart now uses the template's location field to determine where in the note to insert.

plugin.commands.name: todayStart
plugin.commands.description: Apply Daily Note Template to Today's Calendar Note

plugin.commands.name: todayEnd
plugin.commands.description: Apply Day End Template to Today's Calendar Note

plugin.commands.name: dayReview
plugin.commands.description: Ask Journal questions for an end-of-day review (requires configuring)

plugin.commands.name: weekReview
plugin.commands.description: Ask Journal questions for an end-of-week review (requires configuring)

plugin.commands.name: monthReview
plugin.commands.description: Ask Journal questions for an end-of-month review (requires configuring)

plugin.commands.name: quarterReview
plugin.commands.description: Ask Journal questions for an end-of-quarter review (requires configuring)

plugin.commands.name: yearReview
plugin.commands.description: Ask Journal questions for an end-of-year review (requires configuring)

plugin.settings.title: Start-of-Day Template Title
plugin.settings.description: The name of the template that `/dayStart` and `/todayStart` commands will use.

plugin.settings.title: End-of-DayTemplate Title
plugin.settings.description: The name of the template that `/dayEnd` and `/todayEnd` commands will use.

plugin.settings.title: Start-of-Week Template Title
plugin.settings.description: Optional name of the template that `/weekStart` command will use.

plugin.settings.title: End-of-Week Template Title
plugin.settings.description: Optional name of the template that `/weekEnd` command will use.

plugin.settings.title: Start-of-Month Template Title
plugin.settings.description: Optional name of the template that `/monthStart` command will use.

plugin.settings.title: End-of-Month Template Title
plugin.settings.description: Optional name of the template that `/monthEnd` command will use.

plugin.settings.title: Journal Section Heading
plugin.settings.description: The name of an existing markdown heading after which the Journal/Review answers are added - if it doesn't exist, it is added at the end of the note.

plugin.settings.title: List of moods
plugin.settings.description: (Optional.) A comma-separated list of possible moods to select from.
plugin.settings.default: ðŸ¤© Great,ðŸ™‚ Good,ðŸ˜‡ Blessed,ðŸ¥± Tired,ðŸ˜« Stressed,ðŸ˜¤ Frustrated,ðŸ˜” Low,ðŸ¥µ Sick,Other

plugin.settings.title: Daily Journal Questions
plugin.settings.description: Optional string that includes both the Journal/Review questions and how to lay out the answers in the daily note. (NB: can include line breaks.) The special codes that define the type of question asked are '<int>', '<number>', '<string>', '<subheading>' and '<mood>'.

plugin.settings.title: Weekly Journal Questions
plugin.settings.description: Optional string that includes both the Journal/Review questions and how to lay out the answers in the weekly note. (NB: can include line breaks.) The special codes that define the type of question asked are '<int>', '<number>', '<string>', '<subheading>' and '<mood>'.
plugin.settings.default:
Big win: <string>
New/improved: <string>
Regret: <string>
Focus for next week: <string>

plugin.settings.title: Monthly Journal Questions
plugin.settings.description: Optional string that includes both the Journal/Review questions and how to lay out the answers in the monthly note. (NB: can include line breaks.) The special codes that define the type of question asked are '<int>', '<number>', '<string>', '<subheading>' and '<mood>'.
plugin.settings.default:
What's working well in processes: <string>
Processes that need work: <string>Personal Goals progress: <string>

plugin.settings.title: Quarterly Journal Questions
plugin.settings.description: Optional string that includes both the Journal/Review questions and how to lay out the answers in the quarterly note. (NB: can include line breaks.) The special codes that define the type of question asked are '<int>', '<number>', '<string>', '<subheading>' and '<mood>'.
plugin.settings.default:
Goals met: <string>
New goals identified: <string>
Projects finished: <string>
New projects identified: <string>

plugin.settings.title: Yearly Journal Questions
plugin.settings.description: Optional string that includes both the Journal/Review questions and how to lay out the answers in the yearly note. (NB: can include line breaks.) The special codes that define the type of question asked are '<int>', '<number>', '<string>', '<subheading>' and '<mood>'.
plugin.settings.default:
Goals met: <string>
New goals identified: <string>
Projects finished: <string>
New projects identified: <string>
